dialogueacts.text: we've done some research into the functional requirements that people want out of their remote control .
dialogueacts.label: inf

dialogueacts.speaker: D
dialogueacts.text: And first off we should state that th the remote control's for controlling the T_V_
dialogueacts.label: inf

dialogueacts.speaker: D
dialogueacts.text: and um how do people use it ?
dialogueacts.label: el.inf

dialogueacts.speaker: D
dialogueacts.text: We asked them sort of which buttons were useful for them .
dialogueacts.label: inf

dialogueacts.speaker: D
dialogueacts.text: Um how d how does a remote control look and feel for them ,
dialogueacts.label: inf

dialogueacts.speaker: D
dialogueacts.text: and what improvements would would they like to remote control .
dialogueacts.label: inf

dialogueacts.speaker: D
dialogueacts.text: And we did that by sort of giving them a questionnaire that we'd prepared and asking them to fill in the answers .
dialogueacts.label: inf

dialogueacts.speaker: D
dialogueacts.text: And three quarters of them found that remote controls are ugly
dialogueacts.label: inf

dialogueacts.speaker: D
dialogueacts.text: and that a sort of even higher proportion would spend more for a sort of s uh a fancier remote control
dialogueacts.label: inf

dialogueacts.speaker: D
dialogueacts.text: And that of all the buttons on the remote control , the sort of setting buttons for sort of the picture picture and brightness and the audio settings , um they weren't used very often at all .
dialogueacts.label: inf

dialogueacts.speaker: D
dialogueacts.text: People concentrated on the channel buttons and the volume buttons and the power buttons .
dialogueacts.label: inf

dialogueacts.speaker: D
dialogueacts.text: Uh we also asked them about speech recognition uh for remote control .
dialogueacts.label: inf

dialogueacts.speaker: D
dialogueacts.text: And young people were quite receptive to this ,
dialogueacts.label: inf

dialogueacts.speaker: D
dialogueacts.text: but as soon as we got sort of over about into a thirty five to forty age <disfmarker> forty five age group and older , people people weren't quite so keen on speech recognition .
dialogueacts.label: inf

dialogueacts.speaker: D
dialogueacts.text: There's a lot more th there's a lot lot more older people who didn't know whether they wanted it or not as well .
dialogueacts.label: inf

dialogueacts.speaker: D
dialogueacts.text: Um we also asked what frustrated people about remote controls
dialogueacts.label: inf

dialogueacts.speaker: D
dialogueacts.text: and the number one frustration was that the remote was lost somewhere else in the room and that they couldn't find it .
dialogueacts.label: inf

dialogueacts.speaker: D
dialogueacts.text: And the second second biggest frustration what that if they got a new remote control , it was difficult to learn um all the buttons and all the functions , and to find your way around it . <vocalsound>
dialogueacts.label: inf

dialogueacts.speaker: D
dialogueacts.text: My personal preferences from the marketing is that we need to come up with some <vocalsound> sort of sleek sort of good looking high high-tech <disfmarker>
dialogueacts.label: inf

dialogueacts.speaker: D
dialogueacts.text: A design which looks high-tech , basically .
